channel.title: Vmware on Asterisk, and other worldly endeavours
channel.description: Recent content in Vmware on Asterisk, and other worldly endeavours

item.title: Initial impressions of qemu-kvm (virtualization server)
item.description: The qemu-kvm (http://www.linux-kvm.org/page/Main_Page) package on Ubuntu 10.10 allows you to create virtual machines much like VMware, Xen, etc. My initial impressions are generally pretty positive. I like that it lets you install multiple operating systems (including MS Windows, which I haven’t tried yet), and doesn’t use a web interface like VMware Server 2 (which I’ve found to be terribly crash prone, requiring a restart of the web interface at the least, and sometime the entire server needs to be restarted, often abruptly with the kill application).
